node.title: Jacob Wohl Says Jews Must Have Christmas Decorations To Assimilate in U.S.
node.alt: Police officers surround Jacob Wohl as he taunts protesters during a "Trump/Pence Out Now" rally at Black Lives Matter plaza August 27, 2020 in Washington, D.C.
node.description: The conspiracy theorist's remarks were rejected by users of the controversial "free speech" network Gab.
node.content:
["Far-right conspiracy theorist and smear campaigner Jacob Wohl has claimed that Jewish people should decorate their homes with Christmas decorations to aid with \"assimilation.\"", "Wohl, who is currently facing a $5 million fine from the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) for orchestrating more than 1,100 illegal robocalls, made the claims on self-styled \"free speech\" social media Gab.", "\"I firmly believe that every Jew in America should decorate their home with Christmas lights. It's called assimilation. America is a Christian country,\" Wohl wrote on November 4.", "", "A number of comments in reply to Wohl's post expressed disagreement with his opinion regarding Jews and Christmas.", "\"Or you could... you know.... Practice what we all preach on Gab & allow freedom of choice without getting all offended that someone else chooses different than you,\" wrote Gab user DuxNoctis.", "\"Instead of forcing your beliefs & preferred life style on others who may not feel the same. Just because someone has a different religious belief, does not make them a bad person or something.\"", "Fellow Gab user JVS added: \"America is also a country that included freedom of religion in its constitution. Hanging Christmas lights does not make a person a Christian.\"", "The post was also condemned on Twitter after screenshots of it were shared on the social media platform.", "Steve Hofstetter, who was nominated for a Nobel Peace Prize for his philanthropy work in the comedy community, tweeted: \"I wonder how many Nobel Peace Prize nominees have ever told Jacob Wohl to go f**k himself. Because it's one more than it was yesterday.\"", "Journalist Morten \u00d8verbye added: \"I firmly believe that Jacob Wohl should decorate the inside of a prison cell for Christmas.\"", "In a follow-up post on Gab on November 5, Wohl dismissed the criticism he received on Twitter.", "\"These snowflakes are so pathetic and unhinged that they're now calling me (a Jew) 'antisemitic,'\" Wohl wrote. \"Reminds me of when they sued me under the 'KKK Act of 1871.'\"", "Wohl is best known for spreading a number of false accusations such as Joe Biden having 30 days to live after testing positive for coronavirus in March 2020 and completely made-up claims that Special Counsel Robert Mueller and Dr. Anthony Fauci were being accused of sexual assault.", "Wohl also attempted to smear Minnesota congresswoman Ilhan Omar in a racist conspiracy theory by claiming her ex-husband Ahmed Elmi is actually her brother who she married in order to gain U.S. citizenship. Omar was forced to release a statement saying the allegations were \"absolutely false and ridiculous\" while explaining her true relationship to Elmi, who she married in 2009 before separating in 2011.", "In August, the FCC proposed fining Wohl and fellow conspiracy theorist John Burkman more than $5 million for making 1,141 robocalls to cellphones without getting people's consent first, a crime under the Telephone Consumer Protection Act.", "According to the FCC, the calls made between August 26 and September 14, 2020 falsely claimed that if people voted by mail in the 2020 Election their \"personal information will be part of a public database that will be used by police departments to track down old warrants and be used by credit card companies to collect outstanding debts.\"", "The pair were previously charged in October 2020 by Michigan Attorney General Dana Nessel for allegedly using robocalls in an attempt to suppress votes in the 2020 Election.", "In May 2021, New York Attorney General Letitia James was also granted permission to intervene in the federal lawsuit over allegations Wohl and Burkman used 5,500 robocalls in an attempt to suppress Black voters in the state.", "Wohl has been contacted for comment.", "", "
